holidays.name: International Day of Forests
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and raise awareness about the importance of forests for our planet’s health and well-being.
holidays.origin: Declared by the United Nations in 2012 to promote conservation and sustainable management of forests worldwide.
holidays.funFact: More than 1.6 billion people depend on forests for their livelihoods, including many indigenous communities!

holidays.name: World Puppetry Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day to honor the ancient art of puppetry and the storytellers who bring characters to life with strings, hands, and imagination.
holidays.origin: Started in 2003 by the Union Internationale de la Marionnette to celebrate puppet arts globally.
holidays.funFact: Puppetry dates back over 3,000 years with evidence in ancient Egypt and Greece!

holidays.name: National French Bread Day (USA)
holidays.description: A tasty celebration dedicated to the iconic crunchy, crusty, and oh-so-delicious French bread aka baguette!
holidays.origin: Unofficial American food day to honor one of the most iconic breads worldwide.
holidays.funFact: French law once banned women from wearing high heels and an apron while baking bread — but baguettes won everyone’s hearts anyway!

holidays.name: World Down Syndrome Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness and support for people with Down syndrome, promoting their rights and inclusion in society.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2012; the date 3/21 symbolizes the triplication (trisomy) of the 21st chromosome that causes Down syndrome.
holidays.funFact: This date was chosen because people with Down syndrome have three copies of chromosome 21 instead of two!
